newsitem.title: UK: NWE gas oil presses higher, demand firm.
newsitem.headline: NWE gas oil presses higher, demand firm.

text.p: NWE gas oil rose on Thursday as benchmark IPE futures firmed on mounting tension between Iraq and the U.S. and underlying physical demand remained strong, traders said.
The October IPE contract closed $3 up at $219.50 a tonne. September hit a post-Gulf War high of $226.75 before expiry.

Despite a relatively modest IPE delivery of 155,300 tonnes, the heating oil barge market remained firm with activity picking up in the afternoon. Barges traded at Oct IPE +$8.0 to +$8.50 a tonne fob ARA for second half September delivery, but traders said premiums were very volatile.
Traders said Dutch barge buyers were fairly inactive but German demand was strong despite high freight rates -- which they said have nearly doubled due to low Rhine levels.

Low sulphur material continued to be in demand with premiums talked at Oct IPE +$16/+$17, cif Le Havre. Traders noted that a number of cargoes were due to be offered at the end of the month which could soften current differentials.
There was also talk, that Petrobras had fixed a vessel, the SKS Banner, to carry 80,000 tonnes of gas oil from Le Havre, but this was not confirmed.
